item.title: Hacktoberfest 2020 Report | github-slug-action Maintainer
item.description: This post have been published first on dev.to. Some projects ideas can start from a colleague tweet. This idea behind github-slug-action is one of them (tweet in French). From this SLUG variable need, I start to develop my first GitHub Action. Using docker-based container and some bash script with sed or cut, I create the first version of this action quickly. master end-of-life After sometimes, github-slug-action start to be used by multiples projects and some enhancements have been asked.

item.title: Hacktoberfest 2020 Report | drawio-cli and drawio-export Maintainer
item.description: This post have been published first on dev.to. Earlier this year, I want to be able to automatically export diagrams from a drawio file. This need lead to the creation of 2 new open-sources projects : The drawio-cli project is responsible to generate a docker image with a raw cli of drawio (thanks drawio-desktop) for that. The drawio-export project use the drawio-cli project to enhance initial export capabilities.

item.title: Hacktoberfest 2020 Report | Lessons learned as Maintainer
item.description: This post have been published first on dev.to. as Creator Project ideas come from everywhere, don’t limit yourself and create a public repository even when you may be the only user. Don’t be perfect from the start, you can improve your project during its lifetime. You can choose any name for your project, sometimes a descriptive name, sometimes a play of words.

item.title: Hacktoberfest | Let's go for 2019
item.description: Once again, I’m participate to the 2019 edition of the Hacktoberfest. This month, I will focus on my open-source projects byteslice, a go library to manipulate a byte array, hoff, a go library to run workflows with high order functions - a new name is required :) , and the new one bitframe, a go library to manipulate bit frames using data protocol with encoder and decoder capabilities. But I don’t forget to also work on my shell project : michel.
